title: EIPs enabling and hard forks are broken
body:
There is a data race
```
WARNING: DATA RACE
Read at 0x00c000295508 by goroutine 100:
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.enable2200()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/eips.go:108 +0x87
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.EnableEIP()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/eips.go:43 +0xa6
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.NewEVMInterpreter()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/interpreter.go:123 +0x124
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.NewEVM()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/evm.go:175 +0x777
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.TestEIP2200.func1()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/gas_table_test.go:109 +0x1097
  testing.tRunner()
      /snap/go/current/src/testing/testing.go:1127 +0x202

Previous write at 0x00c000295508 by goroutine 104:
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.enable2200()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/eips.go:109 +0x159
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.EnableEIP()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/eips.go:43 +0xa6
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.NewEVMInterpreter()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/interpreter.go:123 +0x124
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.NewEVM()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/evm.go:175 +0x777
  github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/core/vm.TestEIP2200.func1()
      /mnt/sdb/go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/sync/turbo-geth/core/vm/gas_table_test.go:109 +0x1097
  testing.tRunner()
      /snap/go/current/src/testing/testing.go:1127 +0x202
```

The data race in tests can be solved easily, however, it shows that in `core/vm/interpreter.go` NewEVMInterpreter we don't deep-copying jump tables `JumpTable [256]*operation`. So any changes like enabling EIPs or hard forks will change original jump tables `core/vm/jump_table.go`:

```
var (
	frontierInstructionSet         = newFrontierInstructionSet()
	homesteadInstructionSet        = newHomesteadInstructionSet()
	tangerineWhistleInstructionSet = newTangerineWhistleInstructionSet()
	spuriousDragonInstructionSet   = newSpuriousDragonInstructionSet()
	byzantiumInstructionSet        = newByzantiumInstructionSet()
	constantinopleInstructionSet   = newConstantinopleInstructionSet()
	istanbulInstructionSet         = newIstanbulInstructionSet()
	yoloV1InstructionSet           = newYoloV1InstructionSet()
)
```

1. JumpTable is an array of ref types
2. Each operation includes a few ref types:
```
type operation struct {
	...
	execute     executionFunc
	...
	dynamicGas  gasFunc
	...
	memorySize memorySizeFunc
}
```

So once EIP or hard fork are enabled they will be enabled forever even in case of reorg to blocks without such EIPs or hardforks.

Some logs are here https://github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/commit/189dcbc0b54d49ccd8055a0161d0482f5abd6170
I did not really understand this issue earlier, until @vorot93 pointed it out to me :)
